results.title: I Touch Myself

constellations_other.name: Jan Chapman
constellations_other.description: From an independent Sydney cinema to the world's stage, Jan Chapman's work has many connections to the Australian film scene and Hollywood.

results.description: The Divnyls’ hit single ‘I Touch Myself’ launched the band’s popularity into the stratosphere, with the single reaching #4 on the US Billboard Hot 100 and number one in Australia. The music video was directed by blockbuster and explosions aficionado Michael Bay and was nominated for three MTV Video Music Awards, including Video of the Year.
description_for_label: The Divnyls’ hit single ‘I Touch Myself’ launched the band’s popularity into the stratosphere, with the single reaching #4 on the US Billboard Hot 100 and number one in Australia. The music video was directed by blockbuster and explosions aficionado Michael Bay and was nominated for three MTV Video Music Awards, including Video of the Year.

images.caption: Chrissy Amphlett in the music video for 'I Touch Myself'. Image via YouTube.
images.credit_line: Chrissy Amphlett in the music video for 'I Touch Myself'. Image via YouTube.

results.title: Apple and Google stores suspend Parler app

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.title_for_label: Apple and Google stores suspend Parler app
results.description: After Trump was banned permanently from Twitter and Facebook in early 2021, many supporters of the alt-right movement (including controversial group The Proud Boys) began to use an alternative app called Parler. Google and Apple removed the app from their stores for inciting violence.
description_for_label: After Trump was banned permanently from Twitter and Facebook in early 2021, many supporters of the alt-right movement (including controversial group The Proud Boys) began to use an alternative app called Parler. Google and Apple removed the app from their stores for inciting violence.

images.caption: Image via the Sky News Australia Youtube channel
images.credit_line: Image via the Sky News Australia Youtube channel
images.alt_text: A still image of an Apple store after Apple and Google stores suspend Parler app for inciting violence.

results.title: Gurrutu’mi Mala (My Connections)

constellations_other.name: Connecting through film
constellations_other.description: Film acts like a time capsule to our collective past. Capturing our most treasured moments with family has never been more accessible, with technology right at our fingers.

results.description: Gurrutu’mi Mala (My Connections) is about communicating cultural identity and connection. The artist casts himself in this captivating digital video, highlighting the importance of barrkungu wanga (language from a distance) sign language within the everyday life of his Yirrkala community where he works as a cameraman and film editor.
description_for_label: Gurrutu’mi Mala (My Connections) is about communicating cultural identity and connection. The artist casts himself in this captivating digital video, highlighting the importance of barrkungu wanga (language from a distance) sign language within the everyday life of his Yirrkala community where he works as a cameraman and film editor.

results.title: Flight Patterns

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

results.description:
Flight Patterns was originally developed as a series of experiments for the project “Celestial Mechanics” by colleagues Scott Hessels and Gabriel Dunne at UCLA. FAA data was parsed and plotted using the Processing programming environment. The frames were composited with Adobe After Effects and/or Maya. - Aaron Koblin

results.title: You Wreck Me

constellations_other.name: Laughing in the face of adversity
constellations_other.description: Comedy has been used by First Nations storytellers as a tool for social change. On our screens, humour invites audiences to engage with stories and prompts them to grapple with ideas that they otherwise might shy away from.

results.description: In You Wreck Me, Tony Albert plays on Australia’s self-deprecating humour (known as ‘taking the piss’) to create 50 unique collages that offer a sharp and timely questioning of our national history. Painted up for ceremony, Albert’s political interpretation of Miley Cyrus’ Wrecking Ball ploughs down monuments of Captain Cook, recalling the reductive representations that are often imposed on First Peoples.
description_for_label: In You Wreck Me, Tony Albert plays on Australia’s self-deprecating humour (known as ‘taking the piss’) to create 50 unique collages that offer a sharp and timely questioning of our national history. Painted up for ceremony, Albert’s political interpretation of Miley Cyrus’ Wrecking Ball ploughs down monuments of Captain Cook, recalling the reductive representations that are often imposed on First Peoples.

results.title: Family Rules

constellations_other.name: Connecting through film
constellations_other.description: Film acts like a time capsule to our collective past. Capturing our most treasured moments with family has never been more accessible, with technology right at our fingers.

results.description: This up close and personal series gives an exclusive insight into modern Indigenous family life through the eyes of nine sisters and their mother. Angela, Shenika, Helen, Kelly, Kiara, Sharna, Aleisha, Jessica and Hannah navigate their way though adolescence and adulthood as their mother, Daniella, tries to teach them life lessons. With their own unique senses of humour and style, the girls learn to juggle their own aspirations with the reality of everyday life.
description_for_label: This up close and personal series gives an exclusive insight into modern Indigenous family life through the eyes of nine sisters and their mother. Angela, Shenika, Helen, Kelly, Kiara, Sharna, Aleisha, Jessica and Hannah navigate their way though adolescence and adulthood as their mother, Daniella, tries to teach them life lessons. With their own unique senses of humour and style, the girls learn to juggle their own aspirations with the reality of everyday life.

results.title: Trump, Republicans incite crowd before mob storms Capitol

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.title_for_label: Trump, Republicans incite crowd before mob storms Capitol
results.description: Hours before right-wing insurgents stormed the Capitol building in Washington DC, Donald Trump and his allies held a rally urging supporters to ‘Stop the Seal’, despite there being no evidence of voter fraud.
description_for_label: Hours before right-wing insurgents stormed the Capitol building in Washington DC, Donald Trump and his allies held a rally urging supporters to ‘Stop the Seal’, despite there being no evidence of voter fraud.

images.caption: Image via the Washington Post YouTube channel
images.credit_line: Image via the Washington Post YouTube channel
images.alt_text: A still frame from a video fo Donald Trump standing before the capitol building on a stage, speaking at a rally, wearing a black coat and gloves, his orange face gleaming arrogantly

results.title: Data Tapestry
results.brief_description: Data Tapestry is a commissioned data-art work for the National Gallery of Victoria (NGV) Melbourne Now exhibition. The work creates a departure point for thinking about our contemporary city through ecological, demographic, and systems data sourced from the greater Melbourne region.

constellations_other.name: Future visions
constellations_other.description: Entities is a time-based data visualisation of visitors collecting objects and exploring Constellations. These actions are translated into graphical forms to show what’s being collected, as well as highlighting Constellations that share connections.

results.description:
Data Tapestry is a commissioned data-art work for the National Gallery of Victoria (NGV) Melbourne Now exhibition. The work creates a departure point for thinking about our contemporary city through ecological, demographic, and systems data sourced from the greater Melbourne region.

Working with a curatorial team, data researchers, and collaborating city organisations, we sourced a range of open datasets, and less accessible data, to present different themes of the city: for example 5 years of Melbourne traffic accidents, city trees, waterways, buildings etc. These were presented through a 4 HD projections and 4 channels of audio.

Artist statement about data visualisation

As an artform data visualisation enables patterns to emerge from vast amounts of data. This data echoes the physical world we live in and rendered through a combination of design, programming & digital technology, data visualisation allows us to experience our world in new ways. As a designer data visualisation is not confined to the statistical or the analytical, but is an opportunity to explore the poetics inherent in data – a form of data aesthetics. Similar to words in language, or notes in music, visual & sonic encoding gives shape to data, it poises questions, and expands knowledge, and lets us sense - and in turn make sense - of our physical and informational environments.

Information via http://www.oomcreative.com/project/oom-ngv-data-tapestry.html
description_for_label:

Artist statement about data visualisation

As an artform data visualisation enables patterns to emerge from vast amounts of data. This data echoes the physical world we live in and rendered through a combination of design, programming & digital technology, data visualisation allows us to experience our world in new ways. As a designer data visualisation is not confined to the statistical or the analytical, but is an opportunity to explore the poetics inherent in data – a form of data aesthetics. Similar to words in language, or notes in music, visual & sonic encoding gives shape to data, it poises questions, and expands knowledge, and lets us sense - and in turn make sense - of our physical and informational environments.

Information via http://www.oomcreative.com/project/oom-ngv-data-tapestry.html

images.caption: Image via Oomcreative.com
images.alt_text: An image of a wall of black screen with illuminated lights and data streams representing different aspects of the Melbourne city

constellations_other.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_other.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

images.caption: Image via Instagram
images.alt_text: A screenshot of an Instagram post of a long-legged woman extending her foot to close the boot of a luxury car while holding a baby

results.title: Innocence Betrayed (2013)

constellations_other.name: Setting the record straight
constellations_other.description: For too long, the history of Australia was only told in mainstream films through a white lens. First Nations people have used the camera as a means of truth-telling and setting the record straight for decades.

results.description: In 1990 and 1991, three Aboriginal children were murdered in a small country town in Australia. Over 20 years later, the parents of those children are still fighting for justice.
description_for_label: In 1990 and 1991, three Aboriginal children were murdered in a small country town in Australia. Over 20 years later, the parents of those children are still fighting for justice.
